text: William Frederick Blinn (July 21, 1937 â€” October 22, 2020) was an American screenwriter and television producer. He was born in Toledo, Ohio. Blinn wrote episodes of Rawhide, Here Come the Brides, Gunsmoke, The Rookies, and Fame. He won two Emmy Awards. Blinn died on October 22, 2020 in Burbank, California at the age of 83. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:American television writers Category:Screenwriters from Ohio Category:Writers from Toledo, Ohio
title: William Blinn
